actions.text: On agreeing to the Ackerman amendment (A016) Failed by recorded vote: 177 - 233 (Roll no. 360).

description: Amendment sought to require the Congressional Budget Office and the Office of Management and Budget to conduct a cost-benefit analysis of the proposed abolishment of AID, ACDA, and USIA before those agencies could be abolished and their functions consolidated into the State Department.
purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 23 in the Congressional Record of May 23, 1995, to require the Congressional Budget Office and the Office of Management and Budget to conduct a cost-benefit analysis prior to the implementation of the provisions of the bill which abolish AID, ACDA, and USIA.
